words: Susie orvos és tanár.
glosses: Susie.nom doctor and teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor and she is a teacher.
comment: Pronoun ő only if very stressed - syntactically possible, semantically weird

words: Susie orvos; Susie tanár
translation: Susie is a doctor; she is a teacher.
comment: better

words: Paul tv-t néz és vasalja a ingjeit.
glosses: paul.nom tv-acc watch.npst.3sg and iron.npst.3sg the shirt.pl.poss.3sg.acc
translation: Paul is watching TV and he is ironing his shirts.

words: Paul nézi a tv-t; Paul vasalja az ingjeit.
translation: Paul is watching TV; he is ironing his shirts.
comment: not with the pronoun - difficult for understanding coreference

words: Susie orvos de szegény.
glosses: Susie doctor but poor.
translation: Susie is a doctor but she is poor.

words: Susie orvos de ő szegény.
glosses: Susie doctor but she poor
translation: Susie is a doctor but she is poor.
comment: pointing to the fact that she is the one who is poor out of a set of doctors.

words: Jen vett egy fagyaltot de egy idegennek vette.
glosses: Jen buy.pst.3sg a ice.cream.ACC but a stanger.DAT buy.pst.3sg
translation: Jen bought ice cream but she bought it for a stranger.
comment: Because there is a contrast, the second conjunct can have a pronoun

words: Jen vett egy fagyaltot de ő egy idegennek vette.
glosses: Jen buy.pst.3sg a ice.cream.ACC but she a stanger.DAT buy.pst.3sg
translation: Jen bought ice cream but she bought it for a stranger.
comment: Because there is a contrast, the second conjunct can have a pronoun

words: Paul nem orvos; ő recepciós.
glosses: Paul not doctor he receptionist
translation: Paul is not a doctor but he is a receptionist.

words: Paul nem orvos, hanem recepciós.
glosses: Paul not doctor but receptionist.
translation: Paul is not a doctor but he is a receptionist.
comment: ha nem - if not; hanem - but

words: Paul nem orvos, hanem ő recepciós.
glosses: Paul not doctor but he receptionist.
translation: Paul is not a doctor but he is a receptionist.
comment: ha nem - if not; hanem - but

words: Jen nem vett fagylaltot hanem csokoládét vett.
glosses: Jan not buy.pst.3sg ice.cream.ACC but chocolate.ACC buy.pst.3sg
translation: Jen didn’t buy ice cream but she bought chocolate.
comment: Ő a bit redundant

words: Jen nem vett fagylaltot hanem ő csokoládét vett.
glosses: Jan not buy.pst.3sg ice.cream.ACC but she chocolate.ACC buy.pst.3sg
translation: Jen didn’t buy ice cream but she bought chocolate.
comment: Ő a bit redundant

words: A kérdésre a válasz vagy A vagy B.
glosses: The question.for the answer or A or B
translation: (Either) the answer to the question is A or the answer to the question is B.
comment: Double vagy is strongly preferred here because if we use single vagy we need more clarification.

words: A kérdésre a válasz vagy A vagy a kérdésre a válasz B.
glosses: The question.for the answer or A or the question.for the answer B
translation: (Either) the answer to the question is A or the answer to the question is B.
comment: Double vagy is strongly preferred here because if we use single vagy we need more clarification.

words: Vagy az A vagy a B a válasz a kérdésre.
glosses: Or the A or the B the answer the question.for
translation: (Either) the answer to the question is A or the answer to the question is B.

words: Vagy Paul vagy John orvos.
glosses: Or Paul or john doctor
translation: (Either) Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor.
comment: Double vagy emphasises only one of the options is true, can’t be both

words: Vagy Paul orvos vagy John orvos.
glosses: Or Paul doctor or john doctor
translation: (Either) Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor.
comment: Double vagy emphasises only one of the options is true, can’t be both

words: Paul vagy John orvos.
glosses: Paul or john doctor
translation: (Either) Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor.
comment: One vagy is also acceptable (good?) in this context: normally people would infer only one is a doctor

words: Paul orvos vagy John orvos.
glosses: Paul doctor or john doctor
translation: (Either) Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor.
comment: One vagy is also acceptable (good?) in this context: normally people would infer only one is a doctor

words: Vagy otthagytam a telefonomat a munkában vagy leejtettem hazafelé jövet.
glosses: Or there.leave.pst.1sg the phone.poss.1sg.acc the work.in or prt.drop.pst.1sg home.to coming
translation: I left my phone at work or I dropped it on my way home.
comment: Better to use double vagy even in naturally exclusive contexts

words: John orvos vagy író.
glosses: John doctor or writer
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer.
comment: Single vagy, could leave open another option (the possibility that he is both)

words: John vagy orvos vagy író.
glosses: John or doctor or writer
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer.
comment: Double vagy, more confident

words: John orvos vagy író de lehet mindkettő.
glosses: John doctor or writer but maybe both
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer (maybe both).
comment: Without (maybe both) - single vagy, because you needn’t choose one

words: John vagy orvos vagy író vagy mindkettő.
glosses: John or doctor or writer or both
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer (maybe both).

words: A telefonodat a munkában hagytad vagy otthagytad a buszon?
glosses: The phone.poss.2sg.acc the work.in leave.pst.2sg or there.leave.pst.2sg the bus.on
translation: Did you leave your phone at work or did you leave it on the bus?
comment: No double vagy here because it’s guessing: you don’t have to choose one

words: Az A boltban vagy a B boltban árulnak ilyen márkát?
glosses: The a shop.in or the B shop.in sell.3pl that brand.ACC
translation: Would Shop A sell this brand or would Shop B sell this brand?
comment: Single vagy, same as before

words: Paul se nem orvos se nem ápoló.
glosses: Paul neg not doctor neg not nurse
translation: Paul is neither a doctor nor is he a nurse.
comment: Se nem X se nem Y - slightly obscure. Seen occasionally, such as in written texts and L2 materials; older generations (?).

words: Mike se nem vett fagylatot se nem adta oda a testvérének.
glosses: Mike neg not buy.pst.3sg ice.cream.acc nog not buy.pst.3sg there the sibling.poss.3sg.DAT
translation: Mike didn’t buy ice cream nor did he give it to his sister.

words: Paul megeheti a muffint vagy a sütit.
glosses: Paul prt.eat.mod.3sg the cup.cake.acc or the cookie.acc
translation: Paul can eat a cupcake or he can eat a cookie.
comment: both single/double vagy are ok. Single more likely to be only one

words: Paul megeheti vagy a muffint vagy a sütit.
glosses: Paul prt.eat.mod.3sg or the cup.cake.acc or the cookie.acc
translation: Paul can eat a cupcake or he can eat a cookie.
comment: both single/double vagy are ok

words: Susie orvos; Susie tanár
translation: Susie is a doctor; Susie is a teacher.
comment: The connective és is preferred here.

words: Susie orvos és tanár.
glosses: Susie.nom doctor and teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor and a teacher.

words: Susie orvos; ő szegény.
glosses: Susie doctor she poor
translation: Susie is a doctor; she is poor.
comment: the sentence itself is not unnatural, but the contrast is not expressed.

words: Paul nem orvos; ő recepciós.
glosses: Paul not doctor he receptionist
translation: Paul is not a doctor; he is a receptionist.

words: Jen nem vett fagylaltot; csokoládét vett.
glosses: Jan not buy.pst.3sg ice.cream.ACC; chocolate.ACC buy.pst.3sg
translation: Jen didn’t buy ice cream; she bought chocolate.

words: Jen nem vett fagylaltot; ő csokoládét vett.
glosses: Jan not buy.pst.3sg ice.cream.ACC; she chocolate.ACC buy.pst.3sg
translation: Jen didn’t buy ice cream; she bought chocolate.

words: Jen nem fagylaltot vett; csokoládét vett.
glosses: Jan not ice.cream.ACC buy.pst.3sg; chocolate.ACC buy.pst.3sg
translation: Jen didn’t buy ice cream; she bought chocolate.

words: Jen nem fagylaltot vett; ő csokoládét vett.
glosses: Jan not ice.cream.ACC buy.pst.3sg; she chocolate.ACC buy.pst.3sg
translation: Jen didn’t buy ice cream; she bought chocolate.

words: Susie orvos hanem tanár.
glosses: Susie.nom doctor CON teacher
translation: Susie is a doctor and a teacher.
comment: the first conjunct has to be negated.

words: Susie orvos hanem szegény.
glosses: Susie doctor CON poor.
translation: Susie is a doctor but she is poor.
comment: the first conjunct has to be negated.

words: Susie orvos hanem ő szegény.
glosses: Susie doctor CON she poor
translation: Susie is a doctor but she is poor.
comment: the first conjunct has to be negated.

words: Paul orvos hanem John orvos
translation: Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor.
comment: the first conjunct has to be negated.

words: John orvos hanem író.
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer.
comment: the first conjunct has to be negated.

words: John orvos hanem író de lehet mindkettő.
glosses: John doctor CON writer but maybe both
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer (maybe both).
comment: the first conjunct has to be negated.

words: Paul orvos hanem ápoló.
translation: Paul is neither a doctor nor is he a nurse.
comment: the first conjunct has to be negated.

words: Paul orvos John orvos.
glosses: Paul doctor John doctor
translation: (Either) Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor.

words: Paul orvos vagy John orvos.
glosses: Paul doctor or John doctor
translation: Paul and John are both doctors.
comment: It may be logically correct, but is infelicitous.

words: Vagy Paul orvos vagy John orvos.
glosses: Or Paul doctor or John doctor
translation: Paul and John are both doctors.
comment: It may be logically correct, but is infelicitous.

words: Paul orvos vagy John orvos.
glosses: Paul doctor or john doctor
translation: Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor.
comment: In the case of double vagy, it emphasizes the exclusiveness “one one of them is a doctor”.

words: Vagy Paul orvos vagy John orvos.
glosses: Or Paul doctor or john doctor
translation: Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor.
comment: In the case of double vagy, it emphasizes the exclusiveness “one one of them is a doctor”.

words: Vagy Paul orvos vagy John orvos.
glosses: Or Paul doctor or john doctor
translation: Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor (maybe both).

words: Paul orvos vagy John orvos.
glosses: Paul doctor or john doctor
translation: Paul is a doctor or John is a doctor (maybe both).

words: otthagytam a telefonomat a munkában leejtettem hazafelé jövet.
glosses: there.leave.pst.1sg the phone.poss.1sg.acc the work.in prt.drop.pst.1sg home.to coming
translation: I left my phone at work or I dropped it on my way home.

words: John orvos ő író.
glosses: John doctor he writer
translation: John is a doctor or he is a writer.

words: John vagy orvos vagy író.
glosses: John or doctor or writer
translation: John is a doctor, or he is a writer, or he might be both.
comment: The sentence could be felicitous if the sentence is uttered with a tone of uncertainty (indicated with intonation, pausing, and other co-speech modality).

words: John vagy orvos vagy író vagy mindkettő.
glosses: John or doctor or writer or both
translation: John is a doctor, or he is a writer, or he might be both.
comment: Again, one needs indication of uncertainty.

words: A telefonodat vagy a munkában hagytad vagy otthagytad a buszon?
translation: Did you leave your phone at work or did you leave it on the bus?
comment: The double vagy version is a Yes/No question, which is making sure that the addressee hasn’t lost the phone anywhere else.
